beer.beer_description:
The Rev. James Original is rich and well-balanced with a mellow malty flavour that unexpectedly gives way to a clean, refreshing finish.

The Rev. James ales are based on an original recipe from 1885, and named in honour of brewing legend the Rev. James Buckley, saver of souls and satisfier of thirsts.

Brewed with our exclusive Buckleys yeast, they each deliver a signature taste with a surprising finish.

items.badge_description: It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That’s 20 check-ins with a photo.
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 10 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 3!
Travel much? You must be a "brewsetter". That's at least a beer from 10 different countries. Try 5 more for Level 3!

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 150 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 31!

items.badge_description: Whether you’re feeling extra special or extra strong, stopping by the local pub for a delicious Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter is always a good decision! That's 90 different beers with the style of Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter. Try 5 more for Level 19!

items.checkin_comment: Malty ruby ale, rich and sweet with a bitter finish. Kept its head too right til the end.

items.badge_description: Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 125 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 26!

Dispensed traditionally by hand pump, cask beers are best served at 55°F. This temperature allows all of the flavor nuances to emerge and permits appreciation of the often unfiltered texture. That's 250 checkins with the serving style of Cask! Try 5 more for Level 51!

While small, the brewing tradition of Wales is quite robust. As early as the 6th century the country began to form its very own distinct styles. That's 5 different beers from a brewery from Wales. Try 5 more for Level 2!

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 45 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 10!

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 30 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 7!

user.bio: CAMRA member, always looking for a new taste. Am a bit like a train spotter, but can't abide standing around on platform
